meanings.definition: (verb) to cause a ship to take on water through a hole in the hull
meanings.sent1: The storm bilged the old ship, making it sink slowly.
meanings.sent2: The sailor accidentally bilged the boat while trying to repair it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull bilged the ship by pecking at the hull.
meanings.sent4: The relentless waves bilged the vessel, testing its strength.
meanings.sent5: The leaky pipe bilged the small boat, causing panic among the crew.
